title: Update regarding GigaTech Inc.
story_body:
GIGATECH INC. FACES HEADWINDS AS CHINA GDP GROWTH DECELERATES IN FOURTH QUARTER

BEIJING/NEW YORK - The National Bureau of Statistics of China released fourth quarter gross domestic product figures at 10:00 AM Beijing Standard Time on Tuesday, revealing economic growth of 4.6 percent year-over-year, down from 5.2 percent in the previous quarter and missing analyst consensus estimates of 5.0 percent.

GigaTech Inc. (NASDAQ: GTX), which derives approximately 23 percent of total revenue from China-based cloud services operations, faces material exposure to the deceleration. The company's beta coefficient of 0.8 relative to China market performance indicates significant revenue sensitivity to macroeconomic conditions in the region.

The slower expansion rate reflects weakening domestic consumption and reduced enterprise technology spending across Chinese markets. Fixed asset investment in information technology infrastructure grew 6.1 percent in the quarter, compared to 8.4 percent in the prior period, according to the National Bureau of Statistics.

GigaTech Inc. operates four data center facilities in mainland China through its wholly-owned subsidiary GigaTech Cloud Services (Shanghai) Limited. The company reported China segment revenue of USD 847 million in the most recent fiscal quarter, representing 23.4 percent of consolidated revenue of USD 3.62 billion.

Industry analysts at Morgan Stanley Equity Research noted in a research memorandum distributed at 14:30 Eastern Standard Time that cloud infrastructure providers with high China exposure face "increased revenue volatility" given the economic slowdown. The firm maintained its Equal Weight rating on GigaTech Inc. shares.

The deceleration in China GDP growth compounds existing challenges for foreign technology companies operating in the market. Regulatory restrictions on cross-border data transfers and local content requirements have increased compliance costs for GigaTech Inc. by an estimated 12 percent since 2022, according to company filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

Enterprise customer acquisition metrics for GigaTech Inc. in China showed sequential decline in the third quarter, with new contract value falling 8 percent quarter-over-quarter to USD 142 million. The company has not yet released preliminary fourth quarter figures.

Currency headwinds present additional risk. The Chinese yuan depreciated 2.3 percent against the United States dollar during the fourth quarter, which will negatively impact translated revenue when GigaTech Inc. reports earnings on February 12, 2025 at 16:00 Eastern Standard Time.
